dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 3931 IH: Angellyh Yambo Gun Free Zone Expansion Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Torres of New York introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to expand the definition of school zone, to prohibit the transfer and possession of ghost guns, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Angellyh Yambo Gun Free Zone Expansion Act of 2023.
Section 921(a) of title 18, United States Code, is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in paragraph (26)(B), by striking 1,000 feet and inserting 5,000 feet; and
in paragraph (27), by inserting or an early childhood education program (as such term is defined in section 103 of the Higher Education Act of 1965) before the period.

subsection.text: Section 922 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:
It shall be unlawful for any person to transfer or possess a ghost gun.
Section 921(a) of title 18, United States Code, as amended by section 2, is further amended by inserting after paragraph (37) the following:

The term ghost gun means a firearm that lacks a unique serial number engraved or cast on the frame or receiver of the firearm by a licensed manufacturer or licensed importer in accordance with section 923(i) of title 18, United States Code, and includes any combination of parts designed or intended to be assembled, or to be used in converting a device, into a firearm.
